rev.diff:
Line 34: Line 34:
Max Moser's '''Auditor Security Collection''' - "The Swiss Army Knife for security assessments" - was focused as well on Linux-based penetration tests.<ref>Insecure.org - Bugtraq http://seclists.org/bugtraq/2004/May/0239.html</ref> The overlap with Auditor and WHAX in purpose and tools collection partly led to the merger. Auditor featured well-laid-out menus for its collection of over 300 tools for troubleshooting, network and systems-fortifying. Its user-friendliness resulted in enhanced usability for penetration testing which led to the formulation of the BackTrack security testing distribution.<br>
Max Moser's '''Auditor Security Collection''' - "The Swiss Army Knife for security assessments" - was focused as well on Linux-based penetration tests.<ref>Insecure.org - Bugtraq http://seclists.org/bugtraq/2004/May/0239.html</ref> The overlap with Auditor and WHAX in purpose and tools collection partly led to the merger. Auditor featured well-laid-out menus for its collection of over 300 tools for troubleshooting, network and systems-fortifying. Its user-friendliness resulted in enhanced usability for penetration testing which led to the formulation of the BackTrack security testing distribution.<br>
â
The Auditor security collection was a [[LiveCD]] based on [[Knoppix]].
+
The Auditor security collection was a [[Live CD]] based on [[Knoppix]].
